name: Hilton Strathclyde

reviews.text: A good standard of accommodation with clean and fresh rooms. Comfortable beds but the pillows were far too soft for me. When I mentioned this at checkout after 2 nights, the girl said "oh everyone complains about them. We keep foam ones, you should have asked"
reviews.title: Excellent food and accommodation but.....

reviews.text: The bar food was excellent -I had a beautifully cooked lamb shoulder, but I had to wait ages and ages. (30+mins after ordering)The bill took so long (20mins+) I stood up to walk out and only then did I receive the bill, but the card machine took a further 5mins to arrive. The managers only reaction to my comment was that it had been quite busy that evening!
reviews.title: Comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent food cr*p service!
reviews.title: Handy for Glasgow and Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a comfortable stay, everything as expected. Thanks for keeping my bikes safe for those many days. The staff at the reception was extremely helpful in giving local information. Good Stay - over all.
reviews.title: Return Visit

reviews.text: This hotel was nice but in the wrong location as it was in a business park but handy for Glasgow and Edinburgh from Bellshill train station about 20 minutes down the road walking,The food was very good.The down side was the dinning area was small as the hotel was full but you could sit around the bar area.The hotel had no air conditioning and the rooms were very hot so we had to leave the window open but it is noisy with the fast main road out the front
reviews.title: a lovely break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here last weekend and found the hotel to be ideally located and very easy tor each via the M8. The room we had was adequate, although was a bit more dated than other Hilton hotels I have stayed in. We had a meal on the Friday night and it was excellent. We had breakfast on both days of our stay and again it was lovely. The food was hot and there was a good variety of foods on offer to suit all tastes. On Saturday we went to Bellshill train station and went to Glasgow for the day. The journey is only about 20 minutes and much easier than taking the car and trying to find parking on a Saturday afternoon.
reviews.title: very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We never used the leisure facilities, but from what we seen the pool looked a fair size and there was a nice jaccuzzi at the side of it.
reviews.title: Hilton strathclyde - disgustingly dirty

reviews.text: All in all it was a very pleasant stay. All the staff were friendly and welcoming.
reviews.title: Hilton Strathclyde

reviews.text: we recieved a stay at this hotel as a gift and it was far from that the reception and restaurant were very clean and modern, however the room we were staying in was stuck in a different era, this was the least of our problems though as the floor as covered in toe nail clippings, the extremely creased bedding was covered in hair and the bathroom door was stuck open. There also was a huge crack down the wall and the radiator was all dented. We also had our tea at the restaurant which was good apart from they decided to tell us they had ran out of pizza bases so our meal would be longer which we didnt mind at first but when pizza arrived it was almost burnt to a crisp ,however i did appreciate the complimentary pizza we received instead the only good part of our stay!!!
reviews.title: Great Stop over hotel

reviews.text: Very good hotel with excellent pool/spa facilities. Comfortable, nice clean rooms. Easy access to Glasgow, ideal for Commonwealth Games. Would recommend the hotel for families. Ideal for person with wheelchairs as all areas of hotel are easy accesible including swimming pool and sauna.
reviews.title: Hilton Strathclyde

reviews.text: Everything about this hotel was ok until I went to sleep! The mattress was of such poor quality that it was like sleeping on a second rate pull out. Woke up feeling achey and with a very stiff neck. Very disappointed
reviews.title: Hotel fine, mattress awful

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on a Friday night early September. On arrival staff were welcoming and had a prompt check in. The bar & restaurant were busy however we hadn't used them that evening.
reviews.title: Reasonable priced & great staff

reviews.text: Our room was clean & comfortable. Although the hotel being very busy we had no disturbances that night.
reviews.title: Tired Decor with Smelly Cold Room and Noisey Drunk Guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before breakfast we went to use the leisure facilities. Again friendly staff, complimentary towels and had no issues sending us in the right direction. Good sized pool, sauna and steam rooms.
reviews.title: Goood experiance

reviews.text: Breakfast was a buffet type with great selection, fresh fruit, cereals, cheeses and also hot foods. It was very busy but we had no problem getting seated and served.
reviews.title: Business Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On Holiday, had free night between resort in Trossachs and resort in Ballatar, Scotland UK decided to spend it in Glasgow area. Hotel offered Hilton quality in every respect plus caught a Winter season promo which made this stay exceptional. Hilton has always come through. Lamb shank in restaurant was 5 star quality in every way, taste, presentation, trimmings, etc price was Michelin 2 coins but certainly 3 star quality, wife had smoked salmon Caesar salad again exquisitely presented. Mind you wait help is not 5 star but prompt, polite, pleasant, and efficient so whose criticizing (got to learn somewhere)
reviews.title: Int Traveler

reviews.text: This was a first time stay here, but we would stay here again. The breakfast is 1st class, but the evening meals are pricey. The staff were extremely friendly, the hotel rooms, general areas, pool, steam room were very clean even the changing rooms for the fitness area were well maintained. Would recommend as a base for touring the area. Found the room WIFI charge for the room excessive.
reviews.title: Superb Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: lovely hotel nice food , friendly staff, pool spa and steam rooms very clean,a wee bit out the way need a taxi into town and back again ,rooms services was very quick ,again very friendly,defo would go back again
reviews.title: two nites away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As usual, I try to look at the possitives first where possible. This hotel has easy access to/from motorway with drop off zone at front and parking is free. Room was clean and quiet and well equipped. Bar and restaurant staff were efficient, proffessional, friendly and helpful. Food was enjoyable but chef needs to cut down on his use of salt. On the downside, there is only free WiFi access in lounge/bar areas but no free WiFi in rooms. At £14.99 for 24 hours this is unacceptable from such a large hotel group. Also, due to there being a bus party staying, we were advised that all tables in the restaurant area were reserved for them but, tables were available for our evening and breakfast meals outside of the actual restaurant area. Not a problem as such but .........
reviews.title: OK but could improve
Hilton Bellshill Scotland
reviews.text: Location in central Scotland perfect for visitors to have as base. excellent pool and spa. Wedding reception at weekend a bit loud. Room and bed were very good. Staff very helpful. breakfast choice and quality 1st class

description: The Space at Hilton Strathclyde - Ideally located for part-way meetings between Edinburgh and Glasgow, merging a restaurant, bar and lounge. Just the place for you to catch up or take time out. Dine at your leisure with light refreshments, snacks and dishes served all day. Whether you want an informal setting to enjoy a coffee or if you want to dine in a more traditional setting for a hearty meal, the Space has it all.Business facilities include relaxed meeting areas where you can work in peace, Power points, free Wi-Fi,mobile charging stations and bluetooth connectivity. The hotel also boasts one of Scotland's biggest leisure facilities.
